content: The "Taxpayer Debt Buy-Down Act" designates amounts for the reduction of public debt under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes a new part on the designation for debt reduction. The Taxpayer Debt Buy-Down Act allows individuals to designate up to 10% of their adjusted income tax liability to reduce public debt. This designation must be made when filing tax returns and is separate from any contributions to the Presidential Election Campaign Fund.
